title: Learning *about* a language does not mean you've *learned* a language [Re: MT method devotees]

media:group.media:title: Learning *about* a language does not mean you've *learned* a language [Re: MT method devotees]
media:group.media:description:
This is in reference to: https://www.mezzoguild.com/michel-thomas-review/

I get that we all have our favorite methods, products, courses, etc. for learning a foreign language. I have mine.

Over the last year in particular, I've received a lot of pushback on my comments re: Michel Thomas. People seem religiously devoted to this method. It may just be because I'm wrong and the method's amazing but I think there's another reason:

Learning a lot *about* a language can leave you feeling as if you've *learned* the language.

There's a big difference.

What are your thoughts?
